main event: A bright unidentified object was observed low on the horizon moving in a zig-zag pattern over Fayetteville, North Carolina.
interesting points: The object was visible for about 3 minutes and was described as much brighter than nearby stars,The observation lasted for about 10 seconds before the object ascended rapidly and disappeared,Weather conditions at the time included clear skies and near a full moon,Two witnesses from a car were reporting multiple sightings of bright lights in August 1968,Overall descriptions suggested it was not consistent with known aircraft or satellites.
witness description: Reliable individuals observing an aerial phenomenon.
